input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Byron-Bergen will be closed to students until further notice. This closing includes all school-related activities including sports and other extracurricular activities.

br.span: Congratulations to all of the students who ranked in the top ten among 2020 graduates.

div.a: Monday Message from Superintendent Edwards - April 20, 2020

span.p: Just a couple months ago, it would have been inconceivable to me that we would be spending this much time apart. Now, we all know that it is imperative to do so. The safety of our students and community is the number one priority. That said, I’m looking forward to a time when the hallways will be bustling with students and laughter again.

img.title: Edwards
img.alt: Monday Message from Superintendent Edwards - April 20, 2020

div.a: 5th and 6th graders 3-D print PPE with a positive spin

span.span: If a health care worker puts on a face shield inscribed with the words “Heroes wear scrubs, not capes,” it might have been designed by a Byron-Bergen fifth or sixth grade student. STEAM Lab Teacher Craig Schroth recently dropped off 100 face shields designed and donated by students to Face Shields ROC, an organization collecting face shields to distribute to medical facilities and first responders in the Rochester area.

img.title: Schroth
img.alt: 5th and 6th graders 3-D print PPE with a positive spin

span.span: Governor Cuomo announced on April 16 that all schools in New York State will remain closed until May 15.
